definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: I will trade my stamp collection for your model boat.
sentences.chinese: 我用我的集郵冊換你的模型船。

sentences.english: It's not too much to say that an album of stamps is a small encyclopedia book.
sentences.chinese: 可以說一本集郵冊就是一本小的百科全書。

sentences.english: You can make an album with this book.
sentences.chinese: 你可以用這本書做集郵冊。

sentences.english: He has four books full of stamps.
sentences.chinese: 他有四本裝滿郵票的集郵冊。

sentences.english: And you can make an album with this book.
sentences.chinese: 而且你可以用這本書做一本集郵冊。

sentences.english: Yes, I have a book of stamps .
sentences.chinese: 是啊，我自己有一本集郵冊。

sentences.english: He gave me two albums full of stamps when I was 6. I developed the habit of stamp collecting from then on.
sentences.chinese: 我6歲時他送給我兩本裝滿郵票的集郵冊。

sentences.english: Leaving the post office, I gave a book of stamps to a guy outside the door.
sentences.chinese: 離開郵局的時候我給了一個人一本集郵冊。

sentences.english: Now we can both have stamp albums.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們都可以有集郵冊了。

sentences.english: He's always rabbiting on about his stamp collection.
sentences.chinese: 他總是沒完沒了說自己的集郵冊。

sentences.english: The salesman looked though my album and offered me sixty marks.
sentences.chinese: 那個推銷員仔細看過我的集郵冊，同意出六十馬克。
